DOC.brief_summary: Background : Subacromial impingement syndrome ( SIS ) chronic disable disease , characterize compression mechanical abrasion tendon rotator cuff muscle , subacromial bursa tendon long head biceps anterior surface acromion , coracoacromial ligament acromioclavicular joint arm elevation movement . After trauma , inflammatory process initiate may lead loss function untreated . This inflammation lead release cytokine ( IL-6 , IL-10 , IL-1β TNF-α ) whose act inflammatory mediator . Physical therapy work treat SIS goal reduce pain inflammatory process . Cryotherapy widely use physical therapy anti-inflammatory analgesic effect , low cost , effectiveness easy application . Objective : The aim study evaluate effect cryotherapy protocol , apply shoulder subject SIS , serum inflammatory mediator ( cytokine ) local pressure pain threshold . Possible change function pain also evaluate . Materials Methods : 30 subject select share two group , 15 healthy subject 15 subject SIS . Function assessment quality life hold use DASH WORC questionnaire . Cryotherapy apply 4 consecutive day , last 20 minute without interruption ice pack shoulder SIS carrier . For blood sample , 20ml blood collect first last day intervention , store -80 ° C .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Cryotherapy Joint Function Pressure Pain Threshold Patients With Subacromial Impingement Syndrome .
DOC.criteria: Definition : The participant select population general screen inclusion exclusion criterion : The diagnosis SIS base clinical examination selfreported orthopaedic history . least 3 positive test : Neer impingement test , Hawkins impingement test , Jobe test , Speed test Gerber test , pain passive isometric resist shoulder lateral rotation , pain active shoulder elevation pain palpation rotator cuff tendon . Fracture , osteoporosis , malignancy , infection , active inflammatory process , pregnancy , systemic illness , physical therapy manual therapy treatment within 6 month prior evaluation , sign complete rotator cuff tear acute inflammation , cervicothoracic spinerelated symptom ( positive cervical compression test excessive kyphosis ) , scoliosis , glenohumeral instability ( positive apprehension , anterior drawer , sulcus test ) , previous upper extremity fracture shoulder surgery .
